title: IMAGIC-500: IMputation benchmark on A Generative Imaginary Country (500k samples)
summary: This paper introduces IMAGIC-500, a publicly available synthetic dataset derived from a World Bank household survey, designed for benchmarking missing data imputation methods in socioeconomic research. It evaluates imputation accuracy and impact on downstream predictive tasks under various missing mechanisms and ratios.
usefulness_reason: Score 80 assigned because the paper focuses on missing data imputation in "tabular datasets" and utilizes a "World Bank household survey" and "socioeconomic datasets". This directly relates to the keywords "Contextual dataset" and "Survey data".
